message: hey guys, I'm the designer at http://whyhello.im would y'all mind checking out the UX / UI and letting me know your thoughts. any feedback is appreciated!!!
When you say: "Yay! Good job, add another!". Will be great if "add another" is a link to add another social network
Everything is sitting pretty low on the page. I actually have to scroll down to get to the button
I would like put links on my BIO
@Krator will you try the upload again, no one else has had a problem so far
Hi Alex, here is my thoughts:
The app its a little slow, you should work on make it faster
I don't have idea what is: "Share your public keys, publish them to the world" please provide more info about it
@Krator as for the slowness, we're on the free heroku plan for testing it out. we'll move to quicker hosting in a few days
I upload a background, but doesn't work... "image broken"
@Krator add another is an awesome idea, I'll get on that
@Krator we're working on getting you markdown for your bio, should give you the control you want
thanks for the feedback guys, keep it coming
@spencer for the signup?
BTW: here is my profile: http://whyhello.im/davidmatus
@alexbaldwin yep on logged out homepage / sign up
Opps!, the filename had "spaces"  , my bad :P http://whyhello.im/davidmatus
@Krator much better, I'll see if we can validate that on our end
stupid flash came through, but it looks like there is a missing module (chrome 9.0.597 beta on linux) The add a service thing is to the right of design.
I want to add links that aren't my blog.
@alexbaldwin I don't think you should put "developers only" on the ssh key stuff. A) designers can add that too, B) it makes it feel like its an exposed admin-only thing
I think "... if you're a geek" or something like that would be more appropriate
http://i.imgur.com/8QyQN.png -- screenshot for the above comment
also, adding a service redirected me to the actual page, while adding a blog redirected me to the edit page. Should be consistent with that.
http://whyhello.im/justinlilly -- my page. Might want to avoid if you're vegan ;)
@justinlilly yeah the adding services is kinda janky from a UX/UI perspective, it definitely needs some love. we're still trying to figure out the best way to present and let you remove services
@justinlilly a ha! yes that's how it should happen
@alexbaldwin it didn't disappear. its just to the right. http://i.imgur.com/g4dCx.jpg
It was taken at a pig picking in SC a couple of years ago.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pig_pickin'
@justinlilly woah how did add services just disappear, I'll look into that hardcore.
@justinlilly thanks man, I agree. (I'm a designer) we were talking about only enabling it if you have authenticated github, thoughts?
@justinlilly if you come down to Texas, let me know and I'll cook some amazing black forest ham bacon for you
@justinlilly if you want to add an extra link you can do so using markdown in your bio area
@justinlilly a pig picking? only in south carolina
the reason I want to add an extra link is to attribute the photo I'm using.
@justinlilly if this happens in Texas (which I'm sure it does), I'm there
why do you @ yourself?
@alexbaldwin ^
@justinlilly btw, good work on the attribution link!!! +respect for being the first person to do that (better?)
black forest ham bacon is the shit. fyi
